page.title: 14SYTCHAMPTON SCHOOL.
page.content: Sytchampton school was built in 1729 it is a charity school. It was started up by{RICHARD LLOYD}a land owner. He charged 1p a week for his workers' children to attend this school. The school was rebuilt in 1926. This building is listed. The village was split up by duel carriageway <A449> and so now there is a scattered community. The children come from a large area. They all come by car even the children who live very near as the <A449> is such a busy road to cross by foot. There are 46 children at present attending{Sytchampton School}but the school will take up to 50 children. If the numbers drop below 25 the school would probably close. There are two teachers at present, one of which is the headmistress. There is a secretary but only part time. The school has a video, computer, TV etc.
